Most Illustrious and Excellent Sir

Herewith I send to Your Excellency Lieutenant Jos√© Alves de Medeiros, interim commander of the Triunfo Squadron, the news of the death of the murderer Farias, which greatly benefits humanity by the death of such a wicked man; yesterday I received word that he had gone down to the Triunfo ford with a villain; at night I sent a detachment to ambush on the path of his retreat, not only to capture him, but also to catch some deserters from the corps. This detachment has not yet returned.

This is all I have to bring to Your Excellency's attention

whom God keep for many years. Camp at Ponta Rasa, December 27, 1842. Francisco Pedro de Abreu Lieutenant Colonel.

Seen by His Excellency December 28, 1842. Daily order no. 12 of the 31st of the said month.

For daily order, the case of the death of Farias.
